intro: Dolichos rufescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed burr legume, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to reddish in color, and the plant produces distinctive, spiny pods that contain several seeds. Dolichos rufescens is often found in disturbed soils and can be an invasive species in some regions.
